1.description: Continues to worry about Ciri's safety and training. He becomes increasingly involved in political matters as the situation around Ciri escalates.

4.description: Becomes caught up in the coup at Thanedd Island, fighting to protect Ciri and Yennefer during the magical and political chaos.

1.description: Continues her magical education with Yennefer, showing remarkable progress but also concerning instability. Her powers continue to grow beyond normal magical training.

3.description: Attends the magical academy at Aretuza, where she begins to understand the political implications of her abilities and heritage.

4.description: Becomes separated from her protectors during the coup at Thanedd. Her powers manifest in desperate and dangerous ways.

1.description: Continues Ciri's intensive magical training while becoming increasingly protective. She recognizes the growing political dangers surrounding her student.

3.description: Participates in the Council of Mages on Thanedd Island, representing Ciri's interests while navigating the complex political landscape.

4.description: Fights desperately during the coup to protect Ciri, but becomes separated from her student in the chaos. Her loyalty to Ciri puts her at odds with other sorceresses.

2.description: The Rector of Aretuza who oversees Ciri's education at the academy. She represents the old guard of sorceresses trying to maintain stability.

4.description: Becomes a tragic figure during the coup, caught between her loyalty to the academy and the political machinations destroying everything she built.

3.description: A powerful sorceress and key political player in the Council of Mages. She has her own agenda regarding Ciri and the future of the Northern Kingdoms.

4.description: Plays a crucial role in the coup, revealing her true political ambitions and willingness to sacrifice others for her vision of the future.

3.description: A charismatic and powerful sorcerer who appears to be an ally but harbors secret ambitions. He shows particular interest in Ciri's abilities.

4.description: Reveals himself as the mastermind behind the coup at Thanedd. His true goals regarding Ciri become sinisterly clear as he orchestrates chaos.

2.description: Continues to be concerned about Ciri's wellbeing and supports her education, though she defers to more experienced sorceresses.

4.description: Becomes caught up in the violence of the coup, suffering severe injuries that nearly cost her life. Her experience shows the brutal cost of the political conflict.

3.description: Redania's spymaster who plays multiple sides in the political game. He understands Ciri's strategic value and works to position Redania advantageously.

4.description: Becomes involved in the coup's aftermath, working to salvage Redania's position from the chaos while pursuing his own agenda regarding Ciri.

relationships.Ciri: Seeks to use for Redania's benefit

1.description: Geralt's loyal friend who becomes increasingly worried about his friend's involvement in dangerous political matters surrounding Ciri.

5.description: Witnesses the aftermath of the coup and helps document the events, though he struggles to understand the full scope of the magical and political catastrophe.

1.description: Continues his pursuit of Ciri, becoming more dangerous and desperate. His scarred appearance makes him easily recognizable and feared.

4.description: Takes advantage of the chaos at Thanedd to make his move against Ciri, revealing connections to larger conspiracies.
A Nilfgaardian officer who was present at the fall of Cintra. He appears during the coup, with unclear motivations regarding Ciri.

6.description: His true motivations begin to become clearer as he seems to be pursuing his own agenda separate from Nilfgaard's official position.

5.description: A Nilfgaardian sorceress who becomes involved in the political aftermath of the coup. She represents Nilfgaard's magical interests in the conflict.

3.description: A sorcerer involved in the Council of Mages who becomes caught up in the political machinations leading to the coup.
A sorceress who participates in the Council of Mages and becomes involved in the political tensions surrounding Ciri's fate.

2.description: The rector of Aretuza's rival academy who becomes involved in Ciri's education and the political situation surrounding her.

3.description: A sorceress who works closely with Vilgefortz. Disfigured by magical experiments but remains loyal to him.
An ancient and powerful sorcerer who participates in the Council of Mages. One of the oldest members of the Brotherhood.
A sorcerer involved in the political discussions at Thanedd Island during the Council of Mages.
A sorcerer who attends the Thanedd council and becomes caught up in the political machinations and eventual coup.
The paranoid wizard from Blaviken who attends the council meetings, still obsessed with his theories about cursed girls.

2.description: One of the students at Aretuza who witnesses Ciri's training and the growing tensions within the academy.
Another student at the magical academy who becomes involved in the events surrounding Ciri's presence there.

3.description: The captain of guards at Thanedd Island who tries to maintain order during the Council of Mages and the subsequent coup.
A servant at Thanedd Island who witnesses the chaos and violence of the coup from the perspective of the common people.

4.description: A Scoia'tael commander who becomes involved in the coup at Thanedd Island, representing non-human interests in the conflict.
A skilled elven archer fighting with the Scoia'tael during the Thanedd coup. Deadly with her bow.
A dwarf warrior who fights alongside the Scoia'tael during the coup, representing dwarf involvement in the rebellion.
A halfling working with the Scoia'tael as a scout and spy during the Thanedd events.

3.description: A fiery sorceress with red hair who participates in the magical community's political discussions.

4.description: A Nilfgaardian sorceress involved in the empire's magical operations and the coup at Thanedd.

3.description: A sorceress who attends the Council of Mages and becomes involved in the political machinations.
A sorcerer who participates in the Brotherhood's meetings and political debates at Thanedd.
A sorcerer from Zerrikania who brings international perspective to the Council of Mages.

4.description: A young sorcerer's apprentice who witnesses the violence at Thanedd and survives to tell the tale.

3.description: The head cook at Thanedd Island who prepares meals for the mages and witnesses the coup from the kitchens.
The keeper of Thanedd's magical library who tries to protect precious books during the violent coup.
The captain of a ship that transports people to and from Thanedd Island. Witnesses the chaos and helps evacuate survivors.
A Redanian diplomat who observes the Council of Mages and reports back to King Vizimir about the political developments.
A Temerian noble who observes the proceedings at Thanedd on behalf of King Foltest.
A Kaedweni intelligence agent who infiltrates the Thanedd gathering to spy for King Henselt.

4.description: A Nilfgaardian operative working to further the empire's interests during the coup and its aftermath.
A halfling merchant who happens to witness the aftermath of the Thanedd coup and spreads news of the events.

5.description: A sorcerer who escaped the Thanedd massacre and now lives in hiding, representing the shattered magical community.
An innkeeper in Oxenfurt who provides shelter to refugees and survivors from the Thanedd coup.
A witcher from the School of the Manticore who becomes caught up in the aftermath of Thanedd.

6.description: An Aen Elle sage mentioned in connection with Elder Blood research and Ciri's growing importance.

2.description: The groundskeeper at Aretuza who maintains the academy grounds and witnesses the magical training.

4.description: An elven sorceress who becomes involved in the formation of what will become the Lodge of Sorceresses.
A sorceress who participates in the political reorganization after Thanedd and helps form the new magical order.

5.description: A captain in King Vizimir's royal guard who helps maintain order after the Thanedd crisis.

3.description: A magical researcher who studies forbidden magic and becomes involved in dangerous experiments.

5.description: A high priest of the Eternal Fire who uses the chaos after Thanedd to increase persecution of magic users.
A bard who chronicles the events of Thanedd and spreads stories of what really happened.
A leader in the underground resistance that forms to help magic users escape persecution after Thanedd.
A border guard who becomes involved in tracking refugees and survivors fleeing after the Thanedd massacre.
A ship captain who smuggles survivors and refugees away from the persecution following Thanedd.

6.description: A criminal boss who runs fighting arenas and becomes involved in the underground networks after Thanedd.

5.description: A professional witch hunter who becomes active after Thanedd, hunting down surviving magic users.

4.description: A young medic and student who helps treat the wounded after the violence at Thanedd Island.

5.description: A halfling information broker who trades in secrets and news about the aftermath of Thanedd.

3.description: A senior servant who oversees the banquet preparations for the Council of Mages gathering.
A wine servant who serves the mages during their council meetings and banquet.

2.description: A young instructor at Aretuza who teaches advanced magical theory to students including Ciri.
An elderly instructor specializing in elemental magic at Aretuza academy.
An advanced student at Aretuza who becomes friends with Ciri during her stay.
A talented student studying healing magic at Aretuza academy.

3.description: The ambassador from Kovir who observes the Council of Mages proceedings to report back to his kingdom.
A diplomatic aide who assists the Kovir ambassador during the Thanedd proceedings.
A Redanian intelligence officer working under Dijkstra to gather information at Thanedd.
A female Redanian spy who infiltrates the social gatherings at Thanedd Island.
A Temerian intelligence operative who monitors the proceedings for King Foltest.
A magical researcher studying Elder Blood and ancient magic who attends the Thanedd gathering.
A scholar focusing on interdimensional magic theory who presents research at Thanedd.
A representative from Ban Ard academy who participates in the educational discussions at Thanedd.
A sergeant in the Thanedd Island guard who helps maintain security during the council.
A loyal guard who tries to protect the mages during the coup violence.
A young guard assigned to patrol the academy grounds during the gathering.
The head of kitchens who supervises meal preparation for the large gathering of mages.
A skilled baker who prepares special breads and pastries for the mage council banquets.
The stablemaster who tends to the horses of visiting diplomats and mages at Thanedd.
The resident healer at Thanedd Island who tends to injuries during and after the coup.

4.description: An elven mage fighting with the Scoia'tael during the Thanedd coup.
An elven scout who helps coordinate the Scoia'tael assault on Thanedd Island.
A young elven scout involved in the Thanedd attack, specializing in stealth operations.

3.description: A sailor on Captain Whitmore's ship who helps transport people to Thanedd Island.
The ship's navigator who guides vessels safely to and from Thanedd Island.
A high-ranking Nilfgaardian intelligence officer who infiltrates the Thanedd gathering.

4.description: A Nilfgaardian operative working to extract intelligence during the coup chaos.

3.description: A sorcerer specializing in alchemy who provides magical components for various experiments.
An elderly alchemist who studies the interaction between magic and mundane materials.
A promising young apprentice mage who observes the council proceedings as part of his education.
A female apprentice studying under one of the senior mages at the Thanedd gathering.
The quartermaster responsible for supplies and logistics during the large gathering.
An official scribe who records the proceedings of the Council of Mages.
A young page who carries messages between different factions during the council.
An elderly scholar of magical history who provides historical context to discussions.
A young noble from Redania who observes the proceedings as part of his political education.
A young noble lady from Temeria who attends the social aspects of the gathering.
A halfling merchant who supplies rare materials and components to the mages.
A local pilot who guides ships safely through the waters around Thanedd Island.
The weapons master responsible for training and arming the island guards.
The keeper of the highest tower on Thanedd Island, responsible for magical observations.
The warden responsible for controlling access to sensitive areas during the council.
The master of messenger hawks who handles communications between Thanedd and the mainland.
The island's apothecary who provides medicinal herbs and potions to residents and visitors.
The captain of the night watch who maintains security during evening hours and the coup.
A mage who specializes in magical cartography and studies dimensional rifts.
A skilled interpreter who translates between different languages during international negotiations.
A court bard who provides entertainment during the social gatherings at Thanedd.
The captain of ceremonial guards who handles formal protocols during the council.
The keeper of magical fires throughout Thanedd Island, maintaining warmth and light.
The keeper of magical archives who protects ancient documents and scrolls during the chaos.
An observer from Zerrikania who monitors the proceedings to report back to his distant homeland.
A delegate from the distant land of Ofir who observes northern politics.
A local fisherman who supplies fresh fish to the island and witnesses the violent events.
A mage who specializes in weather magic and monitors conditions around Thanedd Island.
The master of supplies who coordinates the massive logistical effort for the gathering.
The coordinator responsible for accommodating the many important guests during the council.
A specialist mage responsible for maintaining the protective magical wards around Thanedd.

4.description: A compassionate woman who helps survivors and refugees escape from Thanedd during the coup.

3.description: A technical specialist who maintains and operates the magical portals used for transportation.

4.description: The coordinator who attempts to manage the emergency response during and after the coup.

3.description: The master of signal fires and communication beacons used for long-distance messaging.

2.description: A senior student at Aretuza who helps orient Ciri to the academy's customs and traditions.
A quiet student specializing in divination magic who occasionally interacts with Ciri.

3.description: A religious chaplain who provides spiritual guidance to island residents and visitors.
A magical engineer who maintains the complex magical and mechanical systems of Thanedd Island.
A representative of the merchant guilds who observes the political proceedings.
The treasurer who manages the finances and payments for the large gathering and its logistics.
A specialized guard who monitors and protects the magical portals during the gathering.
An intelligence analyst who processes information gathered by various spy networks.
The official herald who makes formal announcements during the council proceedings.

4.description: A specialized healer who responds to the medical crisis during the coup violence.
A scholar who survives the coup and becomes an important witness to the events.
A minor noble who survives the violence and spreads news of what happened at Thanedd.

3.description: A magical artificer who creates and maintains enchanted items for the mages.
A physician who provides medical care to the high-ranking attendees of the council.
A dance instructor who teaches formal dances for the social events during the gathering.
The master of wine selection who curates fine wines for the diplomatic banquets.
A master tailor who creates formal attire for the important guests and ceremonies.
A skilled jeweler who provides and maintains precious jewelry for the noble attendees.
A horse trainer who works with the stablemaster to care for the many horses during the gathering.
A diplomatic secretary who handles correspondence and documentation for various delegations.
The coordinator of entertainment activities during the social aspects of the gathering.
The chief security coordinator who oversees all aspects of safety during the gathering.
A magical theorist who presents new theories about magic at the scholarly sessions.

4.description: A coordinator who attempts to organize evacuations during the coup chaos.
A fast courier who carries urgent information about the coup to various kingdoms.
A coordinator who helps organize care for refugees fleeing the Thanedd disaster.

5.description: A specialist who decodes intercepted messages and intelligence from the coup aftermath.

recaps.1: Ciri continues her magical education with Yennefer while political tensions escalate. Various factions seek to capture or control her, with Rience continuing his relentless pursuit.
recaps.2: Plans are made for Ciri to attend the magical academy at Aretuza for advanced training. The Council of Mages prepares to convene on Thanedd Island to discuss the growing political crisis.
recaps.3: The Council of Mages meets on Thanedd Island with Ciri attending Aretuza. Political tensions reach a breaking point as various factions position themselves around Ciri's fate and the growing war with Nilfgaard.
recaps.4: The coup at Thanedd erupts into violence as Vilgefortz reveals his true intentions. Ciri becomes separated from Geralt and Yennefer in the chaos, while the magical community tears itself apart.
recaps.5: The aftermath of the coup leaves the magical community shattered. Ciri remains missing while Geralt and his allies struggle to understand what happened and search for her.
recaps.6: The consequences of the coup ripple outward as various factions reposition themselves. New threats emerge while Ciri's location remains unknown, setting the stage for the larger conflict to come.
